meanings.definition: To engage in (a war or campaign)
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were waging a fierce battle against the enemy forces.
meanings.sent2: The countries were waging war for many years before finally making peace.
meanings.sent3: The ants were waging a tiny war over a sugar cube in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The students were waging a relentless campaign against the strict school rules.
meanings.sent5: The firefighters were waging a heroic battle against the raging flames.

meanings.definition: To carry on (a battle or conflict)
meanings.sent1: The knights were waging a valiant fight against the dragon.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were waging a playful pillow fight in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were waging a silly battle over the last acorn.
meanings.sent4: The teams were waging a fierce competition for the championship title.
meanings.sent5: The protesters were waging a peaceful demonstration for their rights.

meanings.definition: To conduct or carry out (a particular activity or action)
meanings.sent1: The chef was waging a culinary experiment in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The students were waging a study session before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The birds were waging a chirping contest in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The workers were waging a clean-up operation after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist was waging a creative project in the studio.
